CatDescriptText: Luis Veges, cook ,West End and Gladys Dixon, Department of Public Assistance Workers, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 2, 1960, pg. 25 with question "What is your opinion of the service rendered by the Pittsburgh Railways Company?  Do you think trolley fare rates should be increased?"  Mr. Veges' answer reads: "I don't think that it is too good.  It could be much better than it is.  There could be much better service on rainy or snowy days.  As for a fare raise, they're making too much now."  Mrs. Dixon's answer reads: "The service is disgraceful.  it is very poor.  They don't deserve a raise unless they give better service."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Luis Veges wearing moustache and light colored jacket with zipper and dark collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Gladys Dixon wearing dark textured coat with square collar, holding open umbrella, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
